Package sorcer.service

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AsyncExertion
    An asynchronus exertion is a service-oriented indirect message with an enclosed service Context and a collection of service Signatures.
    Configurable
    An top-level interface for any kinds of configuration of this object.
    Context<T>
    Service context classes that implement this interface provide SORCER generic metacomputing data structures for storage, retrieval, and propagation of heterogeneous information across all SORCER service providers.
    DatabaseStorer  
    DataspaceStorer  
    DynamicAccessor
    The creational factory interface used by the Accessor facility.
    Evaluation<T>
    A functionality required by all evaluations in SORCER.
    ExecState  
    Executor
    An top-level common local interface for all service-to-service (S2S) providers in SORCER.
    Exerter
    A functionality required for running exertions with given parameters.
    Exertion
    An exertion is a federated service command (statement) communicated by a requestor - Service.service(sorcer.service.Exertion, net.jini.core.transaction.Transaction), to a service provider Service.
    Identifiable  
    Invocation<T>
    The Invocation interface defines context driven invocations on a service context containing its parameters (paths) and arguments (values).
    Jobber
    A service coordinating a Job execution by creating a runtime federation of all needed service providers to execute all component exertions of the received job.
    Link
    The Link interface allows path values of service contexts to be linked to other service contexts using instances implementing this interface.
    MonitoredExertion  
    MonitoringSession
    An interface for controlling the session in the server.
    Parameter
    Any input value in particular used to close over free variables.
    Revaluation
    If an Evaluation that is Revaluation isRevaluable then it returns the revaluated value, otherwise returns the evaluated value (
    SecureIdentifiable  
    Service
    An top-level common interface for all service peers in SORCER.
    Signature
    A service Signature is an indirect behavioral feature of Exertions that declares a service that can be performed by instances of Services.
    Spacer
    SORCER also extends task/job execution abilities through the use of a space rendezvous service implementing the Spacer interface.
    Strategy  
    Tasker
    A Tasker is a service coordinating execution of all methods as specified by signatures associated with the instance of service Task and control flow exertion of task type.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Accessor
    A service accessing facility that allows to find dynamically a network service provider matching its Signature.
    Configurator  
    ExertionCallable  
    ExertionInfo  
    Identity
    Abstract Java class Identity
    Job
    A job is a composite service-oriented message comprised of Exertion instances with its own service Context and a collection of service Signatures.
    RemoteServiceEvent
    Wrapper around RemoteEvent to allow user defined event objects.
    RequestId
    Encapsulates a request id for an invoked exertion.
    ServiceExertion  
    Signature.ReturnPath<T>  
    Task
    A Task is an elementary service-oriented message Exertion (with its own service Context and a collection of service Signatures.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Context.Type  
    Context.Value  
    ExecState.Category
    A Category can be associated with the ExecState and other attributes of executing exertions (see sorcer.core.provider.exertmonitor.ExertMonitor)
    Signature.Direction  
    Signature.Type
    There are four types of Signature operations that can be associated with signatures: PREPROCESS, PROCESS , POSTPROCESS, and APPEND signature.
    Strategy.Access
    When the access type of a control dataContext is set to PULL then the associated exertion is passed onto a Spacer, otherwise (access type is PUSH) the exertion is passed directly on to the provider specified by the PROCESSsignature *
    Strategy.Flow
    There are three flow types of Strategy.Flows that can be associated with exertions control dataContext.
    Strategy.Monitor
    The CONCURRENT flow is controlled by mutex state WAIT, NOTIFY, and NOTIFY_ALL of the control dataContext.
    Strategy.Provision
    Indicates if on-demand provisioning is used for not existing currently service but required in the overlay network of service providers..
    Strategy.Wait
    Indicates whether the service requestor waits for results or not.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    ConfigurationException  
    ContextException
    The ServiceContextException represents an exception that is thrown if an exertion is performed by a service provider failing to process the associated service context correctly due to incorrect context paths, values, or associations.
    EvaluationException  
    ExertionException
    The ExertionException represents an exception that is thrown if an exertion is performed by a service provider failing to process it correctly.
    MonitorException  
    SignatureException
